intro: Silene goniocaula, commonly known as the zigzag catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene goniocaula is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms and adaptive structures for seed dispersal.
